string.text: Would you please change the music! It's annoying...
It's five roubles to change the music...
Fair enough. He who pays the piper...
Pay to listen to more crap? No way!
Hey, if I didn't charge, these guys would be asking all the time!
Okay, put on anything retro...
How about some rock 'n' roll?
Anything. Just not this sentimental shit...
Something a bit more modern...
I also prefer retro...
Okay, but don't expect Elvis...
I'll drink to that!
Okay, let's see what I've got...
Can't make up your mind?
Hello, Stalker...
Can we talk?
One of your men told me I can deal with you...

I'm told you helped out one of my men, Mongol. For that, I give my sincere thanks. I'll put the word out. Any Bandit in this valley who attacks you will answer to me and my boys. If you want to trade, feel free to talk to Core. He's just outside my office...
I've been told you have a key to the underground laboratory...

Ah, it's the key you want! But you won't be the first. Everything of any value went long ago, and there's nothing but mutants down there now. Yes, I've got a key, but don't think I'm going to hand it over for free. You'll have to earn it!
No problem. Nothing in the Zone comes easy...

Well, if you've got the balls, I've got a task for you. A helicopter crashed here recently - nearby, to the east of the bog. I don't know why, but it came from the center of the Zone. I sent some of my men to check it out, but they say there's a den of chimeras close by, and they couldn't get any closer. They reported seeing a couple of corpses in hazmat suits near the helicopter, and an artefact case nearby. So, if you want to try your luck, go and have a rummage around there and bring me everything you find, in exchange for the key...
Chimeras and hazmat suits! I knew this wouldn't be easy. Yeah, I'll go check it out...
Chimeras are very territorial. I really don't fancy going up against a den of them...
I found the helicopter, and you can tell your guys that the chimeras won't bother them again...
I sent my morons to track you, but I've not received their report yet. What was there? In the helicopter?
There was nothing. Just a couple of dead scientists, that's all. Someone must have already got there...
I found a container that I didn't want to risk opening, and some documents. That's all...
Nothing, you say? And after the deal we made! My men saw you carrying a container...
Yes, and I dropped it when the chimeras came after me!
Well, it's been a pleasure to deal with you. I'll have the container and documents, please...
Here's your loot. Do you have the key?
Ha, Borov always keeps his word! Here's your key. And I've some other business for you, if you're interested...
Sounds good. When I'm ready I'll let you know...
And your men saw nothing? From the ones I've seen they were probably too drunk to see their own noses...
This is not necessary. There's been too much drinking here. Let's try again to work as a team. Can we turn to one more order of business?
What is it you want?

One of my men known as Rat has gone missing, along with my PDA. Coincidence? I think not! That PDA was full of our internal communications... Which brings us to business, find this Rat and my PDA. How you get it is up to you - just bring me the PDA and we'll discuss your reward. Having someone like you on our side, whom people trust, can always be advantageous to both of us...
The Zone's a big place. Where should I start looking?
He was spotted recently at the Cordon, but it's highly unlikely someone like him will have got out alive. Do we have an agreement?
Yes, I'll try to find your Rat...
No, not at the Cordon. The Military are all over that place, and if it gets out that I'm helping a bandit...
Greetings, Borov. I found your Rat...
Well done. I hope he's dead. Where's the PDA?
Where's my reward?
Show me the PDA, and I'll give you your reward
Fair enough. Do you recognize this PDA?

Wonderful! Here's the key to the underground lab I promised, and the location of a cache. Also the supply room is open to you, so take anything you need. The cache is located at the north of the Army Warehouses, near the fallen helicopter
Excellent! Here's the location of a cache. It's located at the north of the Army Warehouses, near the fallen helicopter. Also, check the supply room. It should now be open to you...
Good. You kept your word...
Hey, Stalker! Come closer. Let's talk...
Hey, Rat?
Krysjuk! My name is Krysjuk!
Okay! Calm down, I know Rat's not your real name! I have some business for you...
What business could I possibly have with you? I've not dealt with you before...
Borov. You've got his PDA, and he wants your head...
Yes, I took it. It has the coordinates of places Borov keeps his caches. But I can share this information with you if you'll help me out...
Look, I know you're a thief, so I can't trust you. Why shouldn't I just shoot you?
What kind of help are we talking about?
Kill me if you want, but it won't help you find the PDA. It's hidden in a secret place
Listen, please. I've been hiding here for days, but I can't get past the soldiers. I won't live long if Borov finds me. If you can get the Barman to let me pass through, Borov can't come after me...
I'll talk to the Barman, but I can't promise you anything...
Yes, you have gone! Have got! Go there, go here...
It is good that I have joked, and you have laughed... What commission do you have?
Ah, you young reptile! You will tell me everything!

Hi, Krysjuk. I talked with the Barman. He'll let you pass through, but only in exchange for everything you've stolen. It's his reputation he's risking, and if anyone gets wind of this he may need to return the loot to its former owners...
Okay, I'll show you where it is, but who should go and collect it?
Don't worry. I'll get it, and also take it to the Barman
Okay, write down these coordinates in the Dark Valley. In the cache are three Moonlights and a Glassbeads. Take them all to the Barman. If he agrees to my passage, I'll tell you where the PDA is
Hello, Barkeep! We have a request from a bandit...
Hmm, so you're dealing with criminals now. Why did I not see this coming?
Very funny. This Krysjuk, aka Rat needs to hide from Borov. Might it be in your interest help him out?

I've no interest in this thief. Bandits are a blight on honest Stalkers. If he wants total safety, tell him it'll be my neck on the line, and he'll need to pay. I want all the loot from his cache. Once you bring me everything of use in there, I'll allow him safe passage. Tell him that...
Okay, I'll let him know your terms
How's the station master of the Underground Railroad?
Fuck off, Marked One. What do you want?
Krysjuk told me where his cache is. I went there and found three Moonlights and a Glassbeads
That'll be enough to buy him passage. Give them here, and tell him we have a deal. I'll ask the block posts to let him pass...
All of them? I've done all the work. Don't I get a share?
Okay, I'll find Rat and let him know. Thanks...
And tell him never to come back. Bandits aren't welcome here...
Keep the lot if you want. Do you think I give a shit about a fucking bandit?
The Barman has agreed to let you through. Does this solve your problem?
Yes, thank you. I just want to live a quieter life...
I gave the Barman everything in your cache. Do I end up with anything out of this, other than saving your life?

Don't worry, do you really think I gave the Barkeep everything? Your share is waiting for you in Agroprom... In the meantime, here's how to make a Medusa artefact. You'll need to throw the head of a Tushkano, a bandage, a sausage, and a can of food into an Electro...
Thanks, I'll go and look... I really hope you've changed but, if you've lied to me, I promise that Borov won't be the only one after you...
Wolf
Nimble
Fox
Guide
Jurik
Bes
Mole
Krysjuk 'The Rat'
Krysjuk 'The Rat'
Greetings man of science! What are you offering?
And greetings to you also, Marked One. Here, I modify PDAs to detect mutants...
This sounds extremely useful! How does it work?
Each mutant emits a different energy signal. But I need mutant DNA, and up to date mapping information, to calibrate the detector
So which mutants can you detect?

Well, I've chosen the most dangerous:
 - Burer,
 - Chimera,
 - Librarian,
 - Werewolf,
 - Bloodsucker,
 - Pseudogiant,
 - Controller.
Which would you prefer?
Definitely Bloodsuckers. You can never have too much notice of those bastards!
Pseudogiants are far better bypassed, once you know where they are!
The most dangerous mutant in the Zone would have to be a Controller!
To me in general all the same, I and so with them I will consult...
For proper adjustment I need a pair of Bloodsucker tentacles, and 20 Military PDAs
For proper adjustment I need two hands from a Pseudogiant, and 15 Military PDAs
For proper adjustment I need two hands from a Controller, and 30 Military PDAs
I'll find these parts for you, and the PDAs. I'm looking forward to this upgrade
Those giants are a bastard to take down, but I'll bring you their hands and the PDAs
It's going to be tough, but I'll find you those Controller hands and the PDAs somehow
When there will be concrete results, then will talk.

For alteration of a PDA into a detector which reacts to Bloodsuckers, it is necessary to extract a pair of tentacles from one of these Bloodsuckers and to collect 20 Military PDAs. To bring all it is to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration of a PDA into a detector which reacts to Pseudo-Giants, it is necessary to extract 2 parts of a body from different Pseudo-Giants and to collect 15 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration usual PDA in the detector which reacts on Controllers, it is necessary to extract 2 parts of a body of the Controller and to collect 30 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration usual PDA in the detector which reacts on Wolfs, it is necessary to extract 3 parts of a body of the Wolf and to collect 20 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration usual PDA in the detector which reacts on Chimeras, it is necessary to extract 4 parts of a body of the Chimera and to collect 40 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration usual PDA in the detector which reacts on Burers, it is necessary to extract 4 parts of a body of the Burer and to collect 15 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.

For alteration usual PDA in the detector which reacts on Librarians, it is necessary to extract 1 parts of a body of the Librarian and to collect 30 Military PDAs. To bring all this to the Associate and he will alter my PDA.
I Welcome, the master!
It is good to see you!
I Have collected the necessary items for the detector on the Bloodsucker. Here they are.
This is excellent, now it is possible to make the modification. Here, now your PDA is adjusted to detect Bloodsuckers within 30-40 metres
Thanks! that's great.
I've brought what you asked for...
Yes in this cellar what health...
I have your Pseudogiant parts, and your military PDAs...
Your PDA has been adjusted to detect Pseudogants. Now you won't find them by accident...
Thank you, my friend...
How's life, Associate?
In general, in comparison with Sementsky - it is quite good...
Yes! I have brought the parts for the detector...
Well, now you'll never be surprised by a Controller. You'll be able to detect one 50 metres away...
Have a Bottle on me...
It's good to see you again...
How's it going?
I have your Werewolf claw, and your military PDAs...
Well, now you'll never be jumped by a Werewolf.. You'll be able to detect one from 40 metres away...
Now it's back to the hunt...
How are your business on these days, Associate?
Well, you're coming from the hunting, right?
I Have collected the necessary items for the detector on the Chimeras. Here they are.
Well I upgraded the PDA, it is now adjusted for the Chimeras! Now you'll be able to see these Chimeras on long distance...
Ahh, you're my lifesaver...
Hi, there...
Excellent, you're back already!?
Yes, I have brought the required Burer hands and PDAs for the detector!
This is great, now it is possible to make new modification on the PDA! Here, take the PDA. It is now adjusted to detect Burers within 40-50 metres
Now, these ugly Burer creatures will become extinct in the Zone...
Greetings, Senior lecturer...
What do you need!?
I have collected PDAs and hand of the Librarian. Here take away...
Well I upgraded the PDA, it is now adjusted for the Librarians!
Well my friend. Librarians are waiting for me!
Hello, do you want to see another mutant on your PDA scanner!?
Yes, please advise me which mutant to choose first!

Well, I've chosen the most dangerous:
 - Burer,
 - Chimera,
 - Librarian,
 - Werewolf,
 - Bloodsucker,
 - Pseudogiant,
 - Controller.
Which would you prefer?
Werewolf. those creepy night creatures brrr...
Chimeras, better to avoid them, it is too fast for me!
Burers, I do not wish to come close to them!
Librarian. That is big and scary mutant...
Not now, I'll come back later...
For proper adjustment I need paws of the Werewolf, 3 paws And 20 Military PDAs
For proper adjustment of detecting the Chimeras, it's necessary to collect 4 claws and 40 Military PDAs.
For proper adjustment of the detector, which will show Burer on the map, it's necessary to collect 4 hands and 15 Military PDAs.
For proper adjustment I need hand of the Librarian, 1 hand and 30 Military PDAs
I will find these Werewolf paws and bring the PDAs! No more hiding places in the Zone for them...
These Chimeras. I often come across on to them, I will bring their claws and the PDAs
These Burers creatures are powerful and ugly...\n... I will bring their hands and the PDAs
I will find one hand from the Librarian and bring the PDAs!
Associate, I need some help finding someone.

Well, from here we can trace any unencrypted personal PDA, and put a position marker on your own PDA map. For five Military PDAs and a small fee I can find anyone you want, as long as you have a rough idea of what area we should search...
Okay, let's do it...
Okay, I'll collect some PDAs and return...
So who are you looking for?
And their name?
All done! There's a position marker on your PDA!
Thank you...
Someone in the Cordon...
There's a guy supposed to be in the Dump...
Someone I heard about in the Dark Valley...
A Stalker known as Fox...
A guy called Nimble...
His name is Wolf...
Sorry, I've no idea where he might be..
I'm looking for Yurik. I have business with him...
I need to find Bes...
I need to talk with Mole...
This bandit, Krysjuk the Rat. I need to find him...
I'm looking for Guide...
Artyom the culinary specialist. Can you find him?
Hi, I need to see the repairmen...
It's not that simple. I can't allow just anyone through here...
Why isn't it simple? What do you want?
How about you give me some anti-rads and I'll let you through. Deal?
Nice try, but I prefer vodka. Now if you'll excuse me, I really need to get through...
Sorry, I don't have any anti-rads...
How about a medkit, military grade?
It's simple, will you accept?
Yes, here you are...
I have a Scientific medkit, which is much better!
I don't have any medkits...
Simple? Give two then you will pass.
Garik you redneck? Take.
Its a small world Garick, again we will meet.
Have agreed! Pass!
I need some supplies...
I can trade certain supplies in exchange for Artefacts... What exactly do you need?
Ammunition, Grenades...
I need a decent Weapon...
Medical Supplies...
Field repair kits...

I can offer the following:
 
12x70 buckshot for a Medusa artefact
RG-5 grenades(x2) for a Quirk artefact
5.45x39mm cartridges for a Droplet artefact
7.62x39mm cartridges for a Stone Blood artefact
I've changed my mind...
I'll take the shotgun shells...
I'll take the grenades...
I'll take the 5.45x39mm cartridges...
I'll take the 7.62x39mm cartridges...
I'll give you three packs of 12x70 buckshot for a Medusa...
Sounds good to me... here you are...
I'll give you two RG-5 Grenades for a Quirk...
Hand over the grenades then...
Here's three packs of 5.45x39mm cartridges for the Droplet...
You've got yourself a deal...
Two packs of 7.62x39mm cartridges for the Stone Blood...
I can always use more cartridges...
I don't have the right artefact, sorry...

Here's what I can offer you:
 
A TOZ-34 Shotgun for a Flash artefact
A Saiga-12K for a Meat Chunk artefact
Give me the TOZ-34...
I'll take the Saiga-12k...
For the TOZ-34, I'll need a Flash artefact...
Yes, here you are then...
I'll swap the Saiga12k for a Meat Chunk...
Here you go... one Meat Chunk artefact...

Here's what I can do:
 
Medkits for a Stone Flower artefact
Vodka for a Quirk artefact
I can always use more medkits...
You can never have enough Vodka...
How does eight medkits for a Stone Flower artefact sound?...
Sounds good to me... hand 'em over...
Three bottles of Vodka in exchange for a Quirk artefact...
You've got yourself a deal...

Here's the deal:
 
Three Armor repair kits (8 units each) in exchange for a Gravi artefact
Three Weapon repair kits in exchange for a Stone Flower artefact...
I'll take the Armor repair kits...
I'll need the Weapon repair kits...
Three 10% Armor repair kits (8 units each) for one Gravi...
Sounds good to me...
Three 10% Weapon repair kits for one Stone Flower
There can't be enough said about keeping your Weapons in check...
I'd like to purchase some equipment...
The chief currency in the Zone is artefacts!\nWhat do you need?
Ammunition, equipment...
Good weapons...
First aid...
Repair kits...

My ammunition supply is:
5.45x39mm cartridges for a Flash artefact
RGD-5 grenades for a Stone Flower artefact
5.56x39mm cartridges for a Slime artefact
9x39mm cartridges for a Gravi artefact
Nothing for now, thanks...
Cartridges for the AK-74, please...
I will take Grenades...
Cartridges 5.56 for NATO weapons I need...
Cartridges 9x39mm for the Vintorez and Groza, please...
I Can give five packs standard or three packs armor-piercing for one Flash... Which do you want?
Five standard, please...
Give the armor-piercing...
Three grenades RGD5 for a Stone Flower... Agreed?
I need grenades.
I'll give five packs of standard or three packs of armor-piercing for one Slime... Agreed?
Standard...
Armor-piercing, please.
Five packs standard or four sniper or three armor-piercing for one Gravi... which do you want?
Five standard...
Sniper, please...
Armor-piercing, please. Just right for Bloodsuckers...
Sorry, I don't have one. Another time, maybe...

Here are my best weapons:\nThe automatic Special Val (AS Val), is created on the basis of a silent Rifle Vintorez. Its one of the most deadly weapons in the zone. A bargain for two artefacts Fireball\nAn OC-14 Groza automatic with grenade launcher - an compact, reliable, and powerful combat rifle variant for close quarters combat - for a Night Star artefact
I'll take the Val...
I'll have the Groza...
For the Val, two Fireballs. Agreed?
Agreed. Give me the Val...
The Groza for a Night star... Agreed?
Agreed...
For first aid I offer:\nMedkits for a Sparkler artefact\nVodka, to reduce radiation, for a Stone Blood artefact
Medkits, please...
I need the Vodka...
For five medkits, one Sparkler...
Medkits aren't so easy to find, so you've got a deal...
Five vodka in exchange for a Stone Blood... Agreed?
Agreed...
For repairs I can offer:\nArmor repair kits for a Meat Chunk artefact\nWeapon repair kits for a Fireball artefact
Armor repair kits...
Weapon repair kits...
One Meat Chunk for three ten-percent, eight-unit kits. Okay?
Agreed...
Three ten-percent weapon kits in exchange for Fireball... Agreed?
Agreed...
I need some equipment
If you have the Artefacts? Then I have the goods...\nWhat are you looking for?
Ammunition, equipment...
Decent weapons...
First aid...
Repair kits...

I can offer:
7.62x54mm cartridges for a Droplet artefact
Underbarrel VOG-25 grenades for a Stone Blood artefact
7.62x39mm cartridges for a Medusa artefact
Duty armor for a Mica artefact...
I will take nothing...
I need Sniper cartridges.
I will take the VOG grenades.
For the AK-47 give ammo...
Give me the armor...

Although the 7N13 round is good for penetration, its dispersion is too wide for snipers, even at average distances.
The 7N1 standard cartridge is 2-3 times better than the 7N13 in terms of dispersion, but it doesn't penetrate so well
In terms of grouping, the 7N14 is as good as the 7N1, but far better in armor-piercing thanks to a tempered steel core.
For one Droplet artefact I'll give you two packs of standard sniper cartridges, or one pack of armor-piercing... Which would you prefer?
Give standard, two packs...
Exact sniper cartridges are necessary to me...
I'll take armor-piercing, please. They're precise and lethal...
For one artefact Stone Blood I can offer four VOG-25 or three VOG-25p. Which will you take?
Give four twenty fifth...
Three, but more powerful...
Three packs of standard cartridges or two armor-piercing - a Medusa artefact... Choose...
Standard, there is more of them...
Armor-piercing certainly...

OYAG-91D Universal protection! An excellent protective suit for the Zone. In structure: overalls OYAG-9D, system has a closed breathing cycle, a built in system of suppression of abnormal fields. Gives qualitative protection against cartridge and fragmental hits. - Mica\nThe Duty Exoskeleton will manage in two artefacts!... I will trade for three Micas...
Well give Universal protection
Exo? Give, I will test...
You ask Too much...
I have sniper rifles:\nA Vintora Dragunova (SVD) for an Urchin artefact\nA shortened SVU-AS for a Soul artefact
SVD though is heavy, but very accurate, I will take it...
The SVD expert is lighter, I will take it...
For the SVD, one Urchin... Agreed?
Agreed...
An SVD 'Expert' in exchange for a Soul... Agreed?
No problem. Souls aren't that rare...
I have only military medkits in stock...
What do you want for them?
For three medkits one Stone Flower... Agreed?
Agreed...
Sorry, I don't have any Repair kits...
Do you sell any specialized equipment?

No, it's against the rules, and we don't usually offer this service, unlike some governmental services... But we may have a few items superfluous to requirements, which you could repurpose on our behalf. What are you looking for?...
Equipment and ammunition...
Advanced weapons...
First aid...
Repair kits for weapons and armor...

At the moment we can exchange you:
M72-M Gauss charges for a Night Star artefact
M72-M Super Gauss charges for a Spring artefact
An SSP-99M Vega, the Ecologist 'Combat' suit, for a Crystal artefact
12x70mm shotgun shells for a Sparkler artefact
I've changed my mind. I'll come back later...
Charges for the Gauss rifle, please...
Super Gauss? Let's give them a try...
I'll have the combat suit. I hope it's green, for camouflage...
Shotgun shells, please...
For one power capacitor with high performance 9AA elements in a ten-round magazine, we ask for one Night Star artefact... Agreed?
Agreed...
For three Super Gauss power capacitors, one Spring...
Whatever it costs...

Certainly the green Overalls SSP-99M of Vega! Protection of a torso against cartridge and fragmental damage. Effective protection against radiation and biological anomalies. Resistant to chemically-excited environments and other influences harmful to the organism!\nAnd we ask for it only one artefact Crystal.
Direct advertising, give!

We have three types of cartridge for a shotgun, and can offer them to you for an Sparkler artefact:\nThe standard 12-gauge cartridge filled with buckshot. Five packs...nThe Dart has a stabilised flight for consistent flight. Three packs...\nThe heavy Zhekan Slug - Two packs...
Standard Buckshot works on most mutants - I'll have those, please...
Accurate Darts are just what I need...
Zhekan Slugs - Reassuringly lethal to all known mutants!
Sorry, I don't have one. Another time perhaps...
We can offer you these weapons:\nA smooth-bore SPAS 12 shotgun for a Slug artefact\nAn M72-M Gauss Rifle for three Glassbead artefacts
A SPAS12? I’ll have that, please!
A Gauss Rifle! I've been after one of those for a long time!
The SPAS 12 smooth-bore shotgun is known for its high reliability and flexibility. Maybe even the best close-combat weapon in the Zone. And only needs one Slug to do the job...
Okay, I'll take the Spas12...

The Gauss Rifle is one of the quietest and deadliest weapons in existence, because its propulsive energy comes from artefacts and not gunpowder. And despite its enormous destructive power that'll penetrate any bulletproof vest, the recoil is practically non-existent. All we ask for it are three Glassbeads artefacts...
Three? You know they're not easy to obtain, don't you? But your price is still very reasonable. I'll take it...
For your health we can recommend:\nScientific medkits for a Thorn artefact\nAnti-radiation meds for a Slime artefact
Scientific medkits? How many? And are they good?
Antirads? That'll help me save vodka...

It's a medkit developed specially for working in the conditions of the Zone. It's designed for both wounds and radiation sickness, and also reduces a stored dose of radiation. Four medkits for one Thorn... Okay?
Well if these medkits are so good, I will take...
Antirad medication completely reduces radiation. Five doses for one Slime. Interested?
Yes, that's fine...

As a rule we don't stock armor repair parts, but we had a large box of complete repair kits delivered to us several months ago in error. We informed our suppliers but have had no response, so with a clear conscience I can offer you two complete kits, each containg eight repair units, for a Gravi artefact...
Just two kits for such a valuable artefact?
Okay. Three complete kits for a Gravi. Agreed?
That's better...
So do you trade in any other goods?
If you've got the artefacts then I've got the goods...What exactly do you need?
Cartridges, grenades, armor?
A decent weapon...
First aid...
Accessories for repairs...

From ammunition I can offer:
5.56 cartridges for NATO weapons, for a Slime artefact
F-1 grenades for a Thorn artefact
PKM machine gun cartridges for a Crystal Thorn artefact
5.7x39mm cartridges for the Belgian FN P90, for a Gravi artefact
I don't need anything...
5.56mm cartridges...
I need grenades...
Cartridges for the PKM, please...
Cartridges for the 5.7x39mm Belgian FN P90, please...
For one Slime I can give you five packs of standard or three armor-piercing. Okay?
Five standard...
Armor-piercing...
Two grenades for a Thorn... Agreed?
I need grenades...
Two boxes of cartridges for a Crystal Thorn artefact. Agreed?
Agreed...
Four packs of cartridges for a Gravi. Agreed?
Agreed...
Sorry, I don't have one. Another time perhaps...
I can offer:\nA Belgian FN P90 for a Goldfish artefact\nAn FN2000 automatic with a 40mm grenade launcher, sight-module, and fire control for three Soul artefacts
Give me the Belgian FN P90...
I've wanted for a long time to get my hands on a FN2000...
Where is the Goldfish?
Here, take away...
The cost is three Souls...
Here take these Souls...
Well, I can offer you:\nMedkits, for a Medusa artefact\nAntirads, for a Quirk artefact...
I'll take the medkits...
You won't survive long in the Zone without Antirads...
For five medkits one Medusa... agree?
Agreed...
Five Antirads in exchange for a Quirk... Okay?
Yes, that's fine...
Well, I can offer you:\nWeapon repair kits, for a Stone Flower artefact
For armor, please...
Weapon kits, please...
For three ten-percent, eight-unit kits - one Gravi... Okay?
Okay...
Three ten-percent weapon kits in exchange for Stone Flower... Okay?
Yes, I accept...
I've never seen this type of repair kit before. How do I use it?

standard - When you open it up, it'll scan all the weapons and armor you're carrying, and inform you which ones can be used for spares. You select which items should be salvaged, but be careful not to choose your own kit! Repairs to your weapons will be the ones you're holding, not in your backpack. Repairs to armor will be to what you're wearing. If your kit's too badly damaged, then it may be beyond simple repair. The unit will send a message to your PDA via Bluetooth, and you'll need to see a weapons or armor specialist. If you're carrying something like a detector instead of a pistol, the kit won't recognise it, and you'll get a message telling you to put it away. That's all - just play with it. Oh, a useful tip - if you're ever in a place where you can't carry all the loot you find, then strip it down for spare parts instead. That'll also prevent other bastards finding it, and using it against you...
I will make sure to keep it on me at all times, thanks!
I need some equipment
Please understand that money is of no use here. Only artefacts are accepted in trade... What are you looking for?
Ammo, grenades, decent body armor...
Good weapons...
First aid...
Repair kits...

I can offer:
Sniper cartridges, for a Meat Chunk artefact
9x39 cartridges for the Shaft and the Vintorez, for a Gravi artefact
Gauss charges, for a Fireball artefact
Military SKAT10 armor, for three Urchin artefacts
Ah, sorry. Not at the moment, thanks...
How many sniper cartridges?
Vintorez cartridges, please
Gauss charges? How many?
The SKAT10 armor for how much?

Although the 7N13 round is good for penetration, its dispersion is too wide for snipers, even at average distances.
The 7N1 standard cartridge is 2-3 times better than the 7N13 in terms of dispersion, but it doesn't penetrate so well
In terms of grouping, the 7N14 is as good as the 7N1, but far better in armor-piercing thanks to a tempered steel core.
For a Meat Chunk I'll give you two packs of standard sniper cartridges, or one pack of armor-piercing. Your choice...
Two packs of standard, please...
I need accurate sniper cartridges...
Armor-piercing, please, for distance...
Five packs of standard, four packs of sniper, or three packs of armor-piercing, for one Gravi... What type?
Give five standard...
Sniper, please.
Armor piercing - for Bloodsuckers...
One completely charged node for a Fireball...
I agree, here's a Fireball
Three Urchins and the SKAT10 is yours...
Here's three Urchins...
Sorry, I don't have them...
I can offer a special silenced BCC Vintorez with flash suppression for snipers...
What are you asking for it?
A Saiga - that's quite something!.
Just one Crystal... Agreed?
Agreed!
A Saiga in exchange for a Meat Chunk... Sound good to you?
Yes, it does. Meat Chunks aren't that difficult to find...
I only have military medkits...
And what you ask?
You won't survive long in the Zone without vodka...
For three medkits one Crystal Thorn... Agreed?
Agreed...
Five bottles in exchange for a Quirk... Agreed?
Agreed...
Well, I can offer you:\nArmor repair kits, for a Flash artefact
How many kits?
For weapon repair...
For three ten-percent, eight-unit kits, one Flash... Agreed?
Agreed...
Three ten-percent weapon complete kits in exchange for a Stone Flower... Okay?
Yes, please...
I need some equipment...
I'll do my best for you but I'll need to replace them, so I'll need some artefacts in exchange... What do you need?
Cartridges...
Good weapons...
Medkits...
Repair kits...

Here's the ammunition I have:
Shotgun cartridges, for a Thorn artefact
RGD-5 grenades, for a Slime artefact
5.56x39mm cartridges, for a Droplet artefact
7.62x39mm cartridges, for a Flash artefact
Nothing for now, thanks...
How many shotgun shells?
Grenades, please...
Cartridges for NATO weapons, please...
AK-47 cartridges...
For five packs of shotgun shells - one Thorn... Agreed?
Agreed...
Five grenades for one Slime... Okay?
I need grenades...
Three packs of cartridges - one Droplet artefact... Agreed?
I accept...
Three packs of cartridges - Flash... agree?
Yes, the stopping power is tremendous!...
Sorry, I don't have one. Another time perhaps...

Well, I can offer you a SiG sniper rifle. It was created for urban combat, so several components have been machined down or replaced. This reduced the weight by half, but kept deterioration to a minimum. There's a fixed optical sight with an increased frequency rate... I can swap it for some Mica artefacts\nIf you're desperate, I've an old but reliable AK-47, for a Soul artefact...
How many Micas for the sniper SiG?
The AK-47 will do...
Three should be enough...
Here are your artefacts. Thank you...
Soul that is?
Is available, have specially reserved...
Well, I can offer you:\nMedkits, for a Slug artefact\nAntirads, for a Stone Flower artefact
Medkits? What kind, and how many?
Antirads? How many?
Three Scientific kits for one Slug... Okay?
Agreed...
Five Antirads in exchange for one Stone Flower... Okay?
Agreed...
I only have Repair kits for weapons...
For armor, please...
And what do you need for them?
For three ten-percent, eight-unit kits one Gravi... Okay?
Agreed...
Three ten-percent weapon complete kits in exchange for a Crystal Thorn... Okay?
Yes, please...
Hi, what are you selling?
I'm in charge of provisions here. We're looking for people who can get food for us. I can make it worth your while...
What do you need? And what are you offering?

We don't need any money or artefacts. Those Duty bastards are trying to cut off our supplies and starve us out, and so far they've been doing a good job of it. We need food and fresh water. If you can get us some beer and cigars that would be even better!
What kind of cartridges are you offering?
Do you have any good weapons?
What medical supplies do you have?
Do you have any repair kits?

For cartridges:
Five sandwiches will get you one box of 5.45x39mm
Two bars of chocolate gets you one RGD-5 Grenade
Two cans of '100 Rads' beer gets you a box of 9x19mm +P+
Five loaves of bread get you an F1 grenade
Sorry, nothing to trade today...
I'll take those 5.45 cartridges, please...
I'll have an RGD-5 grenade...
The 9x19 armor piercing...
I'll have an F-1...
Give me the sandwich first and then you can have your cartridges...
Yes, here they are...
Those are my favorites!
I'll see if I can get you some more...
Energy drinks are needed here...
Go on, have a drink...
This bread had better be fresh! Half the guys here are shitting blood from irradiated food...
Give me the grenades...
Sorry, I'm out. Maybe next time...
You want weapons? Here's what I have:\nThe AN-94 'Abakan' will cost you ten tins of canned food\nThe HK MP5 will cost you five sausages
I need an Abakan...
The MP-5, please...
Hand over the canned food...
Here you are, enjoy!
There'd better not be maggots in it...
It's good. Check for yourself...
This is what's available from our infirmary:\nTwo flasks of water get you one medkit\nFive sandwiches get you one Cossacks vodka
I'll take the medkit...
I'll take the vodka...
Finally, some fresh water...
There you are, drink up...
Five sandwiches for a bottle...
Ah, vodka! You can never drink enough of it...
Repair kits:\nThree 'Zone' beers will get you one Armor repair kit\nThree Cuban cigars will get you one Weapon repair kit
I'll take the Armor kit.
Weapon kits are what I need. Here, enjoy these Cuban cigars...
Do you have the beer?
Here's three beers. Enjoy!
Wow, it's been too long since I enjoyed one of these...
They're not easy to find in the Zone...
Do you sell equipment?
Yes, but only for vodka. What are looking for?
Cartridges, grenades, and body armor...
A decent combat rifle or machine gun...
Military medkits...

Well, if you can get me vodka, I can get you:
5.45x39mm cartridges for the AK-74
F-1 grenades
7.62 PKM machine gun cartridges
A decent armored suit
AK-74 cartridges, please...
F-1 grenades...
PKM rounds...

I sell two versions of that ammo
A small box for seven bottles of vodka
A larger box for twelve bottles of vodka
 
Your choice...
I'll take the armor, but only if its new...
I can give five packs of standard or three packs armor-piercing for three bottles... up to you?
Five standard, please...
The armor-piercing, please...
An F-1 grenade for a bottle of vodka... Agreed?
Agreed...
A box of 100 cartridges for seven bottles...
One box of 250 cartridges for twelve bottles...
I really need it though, I will accept SKAT9...

This armor just came from the warehouse!
I have two types:
A SKAT9 for fifteen bottles
A SKAT10 for twenty five bottles...
But the SKAT10 isn't, er, accessible at the moment...
Okay, I'll take the SKAT10...

This armor just came from the warehouse!
I have two types:
A SKAT9 for fifteen bottles
A SKAT10 for twenty five bottles...
Sorry, not enough vodka. I'll come back...

I can get you:\nAn Abakan equipped with a 3h-fold optical sight for sniper fire. The optics built into the case have a more powerful zoom than the standard sights\nA PKM machine gun - strong and heavy, but very powerful with hard-hitting rounds and a 100 shot magazine capacity. Guaranteed to give the Chimeras a surprise!
An Abakan sniper? How many bottles?
How much vodka for the PKM?
The gun is first class! Fifteen bottles I want... agree?
Its a deal, here's your vodka...
Look, bringing out a PKM machine gun without being seen is no easy task... It'll cost you a case of vodka - 20 bottles. Deal?
Deal...
Look, bringing out a PKM machine gun without being seen is no easy task...\n... Oh, it seems that I've already sold the last one...
I really need this weapon. I'll be back for a day or two...
Yes, Military medkits are twice as effective as standard kits...
And how many will you give?
Two medkits for a bottle...
Agreed...
You said you could supply equipment?
Yes, but first bring some vodka and then I'll help you out, depending on how many you bring...\nWhat exactly do you want?

Well, for vodka I can exchange:
5.45x39mm cartridges for the AK-74
RGD5 grenades
7.62 cartridges for the AK-47
Sniper cartridges
Berill-5M armor
I'll take armor...
For one Berill-5M armor, I want fifteen bottles... Agreed?
Agreed...
Cartridges, grenades, and some good armor...
A decent combat rifle or a machine gun?
Military medkits are unique. Do you have any spare...

Well, for vodka I can exchange:
5.45x39mm cartridges for the AK-74
RGD5 grenades
7.62 cartridges for the AK-47
Sniper cartridges
Nothing for now, thanks...
I'll take cartridges for the AK-74...
I need grenades
I'll take the AK-47 ammo...
The Sniper - the king of the Zone, give me some cartridges...
I can give five packs of standard or three packs of armor-piercing for three bottles... up to you?
Five packs of standard, please...
The armor-piercing, please...
Two grenades = one vodka... Okay?
I need grenades.
Cartridges only armor-piercing - five bottles for three packs...
Agreed...
A pack of sniper cartridges - three bottles...
If that's what it costs...
Sorry, I don't have one. Another time perhaps...
I can get you:\nAn Abakan. A powerful, reliable weapon\nAn AK-47. A classic weapon all over the world, reliable and efficient...
An Abakan? How many bottles you ask?
An AK-47! How much vodka?
I want ten bottles... Agreed?
Certainly! Here's the vodka...
It's cheap... Eight bottles and it's yours...
Agreed...
They're twice as effective as standard kits... Real soldiers protect their health...
And how many will you give?
Two medkits for a bottle...
Agreed!
Stalker, we need to talk...
Yes, I believe we can be of service to each other...
Interesting. I'm listening...
Do you know where the documents are located on the third floor?

And that! We hardly sleep with this case in embrace... In any way an opportunity will not wait what to send all this shit to the center... On hearings there that that with Burner a brain is connected... Or with a way brains zombie...\nAnd you that what advantage of them?
There is an interest, time is asked...
Interest is? And in what you estimate this interest?
Well not in gold reserves in Russia... And there are variants?
Has got us here to sit... You of binge, neither women, nor entertainments... I to you so will tell - for good binge all can be got... got it?
Well very good binge I do not promise, but vodka it is possible to adjust... Not of burning...
Appears so... A box of vodka - and the case is yours... That's a bargain yes?
A bargain! there Will be a box of vodka for you!
Eh of the fighter! The native land for vodka will sell... Itself I will extract...
\nIn exchange for twenty bottles of vodka, Ensign Sherstyuk agrees to get you a case of documents...
Borov has sent me to survey the site of a helicopter crash which is located behind a bog, just south of the lab, in the Dark Valley. All that is valuable - we must drag to Borov...

\nThe Bandit known by the nickname 'Rat' has compiled many secrets in his PDA. Borov wants the return of this PDA. In any way. A mark on a map where the Rat disappeared, it is possible that the Associate from the '100 Rads' bar can pinpoint his location.
Hello, the vodka has arrived!
Ah, you're a good man! Let's take a look...
Have you brought the documents?
The word of a military man is his bond! Here are your documents...
Here's your vodka...
Hold this suitcase, do not strain yourself now...

Can you supply me with another Toolbox?
Did you go and lose yours or something?
Just answer the question...
Yeah, I can provide you with another one... but...
But, what?...
But these things aren't cheap. It will cost you ten Medusa artefacts...
Okay, fine... it's not like I have a choice... here you go...
That's a bit steep, don't you think?!
That's what I like about you, Marked One... you never haggle...
You drive a hard bargain... Okay, fine, make it seven...
You want to make something of it?... Go ahead!
Thanks. I'll be back for it when I have the artefacts...
